title: Warm premium artisan handicrafts gifting landing page (single-page)

requirements.summary: Build a single-page, scrollable, high-converting landing page with warm premium artisan styling and consistent section layout.
acceptanceCriteria: Landing page is implemented as a single, scrollable page with clearly separated sections and consistent spacing/typography/colors.
Visual theme reads as warm + premium + artisan (e.g., earthy palette, textured accents, refined typography), without using a blue/purple primary palette.
Page is fully responsive (mobile/tablet/desktop) and maintains readable contrast and accessible font sizing.

file_operations.description: Create the single-page landing composition (one scrollable page) with all required sections, consistent layout container, and responsive structure; ensure no additional top-level routes/pages are introduced.
Create a shared layout wrapper (header/section container/consistent spacing) to enforce consistent styling and section separation across the landing page.
Create a reusable Section wrapper that standardizes spacing, max-width, and semantic headings to keep visual consistency across all sections.
Add the Tailwind entry CSS and base styles used by the app (since the app imports ./index.css from src); include baseline typography, focus styles, and warm artisan theme variables.
Adjust Tailwind theme usage (as needed) to support warm premium artisan styling (e.g., container/typography defaults) while keeping the existing CSS-variable color approach.

requirements.summary: Implement a conversion-focused hero with headline/subheadline, two CTAs, trust-signal badges, and a premium hero visual.
acceptanceCriteria: Hero contains 2 CTAs with distinct visual hierarchy (primary vs secondary).
Hero includes at least 3 trust signals displayed as badges/chips with icons.
CTA buttons scroll to the relevant sections (customization form / curated hampers section).

file_operations.description: Implement the hero section with English headline/subheadline, primary/secondary CTA buttons, trust-signal badges with icons, and the hero image wired from frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-handicrafts-gifting.dim_1600x900.png; ensure CTAs trigger scroll-to-section behavior.
Create a shadcn/ui-style Button component wrapper for consistent primary/secondary CTA styling across the page. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create a shadcn/ui-style Badge/Chip component for trust signals (with icon slot) used in the hero and elsewhere. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add a small utility to scroll to stable section IDs (with optional offset) for CTA interactions on mobile/desktop.
Wire HeroSection into the landing page composition and ensure CTA targets match the section IDs used across the page.

requirements.summary: Add curated hampers, customization explainer, artisan story/values, social proof, interactive FAQ, and final CTA banner sections with consistent design.
acceptanceCriteria: Each section has a clear heading, supporting copy in English, and a consistent component style (cards, chips, separators).
Curated Hampers section shows at least 3 hamper examples with name, short description, and ‘Request This Hamper’ CTA.
FAQ is interactive (accordion-style) and includes at least 5 questions relevant to customization, lead time, shipping, and bulk/corporate gifting.
Final CTA section reiterates primary conversion action and links to the form.

file_operations.description: Create the Curated Hampers showcase with 3–6 cards, each with image, name, short description, and a ‘Request This Hamper’ CTA that scrolls to the customization form; wire images from frontend/public/assets/generated/hamper-set-1.dim_900x600.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/hamper-set-2.dim_900x600.png, and frontend/public/assets/generated/hamper-set-3.dim_900x600.png.
Create a step-by-step explainer section for customization (clear numbered steps, premium microcopy) that leads naturally into the lead form.
Create the artisan story/values section emphasizing handmade craftsmanship, ethical sourcing, and premium finishing with warm premium typography.
Create a social proof section with testimonials/ratings styled consistently with the rest of the page (cards, stars/badges as appropriate).
Create an interactive FAQ section (accordion-style) with at least 5 relevant questions; ensure keyboard accessibility and visible focus states for triggers.
Create a final CTA banner that reiterates the primary conversion action and scrolls to the customization form section.

Create a shadcn/ui-style Card component for consistent premium card styling across curated hampers, testimonials, and other card-based sections. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create an accessible accordion component (keyboard-friendly triggers, focus management, and ARIA where applicable) used by the FAQ section. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create a lightweight separator/divider component to keep section separation consistent. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire all required sections into the single-page layout in the correct order and ensure each is reachable via in-page scroll navigation (no orphan sections/components).

requirements.summary: Implement a lead-capture customization form with validation, backend submission call, loading state, and success confirmation.
acceptanceCriteria: Form validates required fields (name, email, occasion, budget, quantity) and shows inline error messages.
On submit, form calls the backend and shows a non-blocking loading state; on success it resets (or preserves) fields and displays a confirmation message.
No third-party email/SMS integrations are used.

file_operations.description: Create the lead-capture form UI collecting required fields (name, email, occasion, budget, quantity) plus optional fields (phone, preferred items/themes, delivery city/pincode, notes); implement client-side validation with inline errors, a loading state, and a success confirmation message.
Add a hook that uses the existing actor to submit a hamper lead (submitHamperLead) and exposes loading/success/error state for the form.
Create a shadcn/ui-style Input component wrapper to standardize text/number inputs and focus styles used in the lead form. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create a shadcn/ui-style Textarea component wrapper for preferred items/themes and notes fields, with consistent styling. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create a shadcn/ui-style Select component wrapper (or equivalent accessible select) for occasion type and budget range fields. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create a shadcn/ui-style Label component to ensure consistent form labeling and accessibility. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire CustomizeFormSection into the landing page and ensure its section ID matches CTA scroll targets (primary CTA and final CTA).

requirements.summary: Add analytics-friendly structure with semantic headings, stable section IDs, and centralized event hooks for key actions.
acceptanceCriteria: Each major section has a stable DOM id (e.g., #curated, #customize, #testimonials, #faq).
Primary CTA scroll behavior uses these IDs and works on mobile and desktop.
Key actions are centralized in code (single handler functions) so adding real analytics later is straightforward, without integrating any external analytics SDK now.

file_operations.description: Create centralized event hook functions (e.g., logPrimaryCTAClick, logSecondaryCTAClick, logFormSubmitSuccess) implemented as internal logs/function calls only (no external analytics SDK).
Ensure semantic headings structure (h1 in hero, h2 per major section) and stable section IDs are applied consistently through the shared layout/Section wrapper.
Connect hero CTA clicks to centralized analytics hook functions and use stable section IDs for scroll behavior.
Ensure the curated section has a stable ID (e.g., curated) and that ‘Request This Hamper’ CTAs use the shared scroll utility and centralized action handlers.
Call centralized analytics hook functions on successful form submission and ensure the form section uses a stable ID (e.g., customize).

requirements.summary: Meet baseline UX quality: fast render, optimized static images, accessible interactions, and polished premium microcopy (English only).
acceptanceCriteria: All interactive elements are keyboard accessible and show visible focus styles.
Images are served as static assets and sized appropriately to avoid layout shift.
Copy is coherent, premium in tone, and consistent (no placeholder lorem ipsum).

file_operations.description: Add visible focus styles and baseline typography rules to improve keyboard accessibility and premium feel; ensure contrast and font sizing remain accessible.

Ensure hero image uses the static asset frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-handicrafts-gifting.dim_1600x900.png with explicit sizing attributes and appropriate loading behavior to minimize layout shift.

Ensure hamper card images use static assets (frontend/public/assets/generated/hamper-set-1.dim_900x600.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/hamper-set-2.dim_900x600.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/hamper-set-3.dim_900x600.png) with explicit sizing attributes to reduce CLS and improve perceived performance.
Verify accordion interactions are keyboard accessible (tab/focus/enter/space) and that focus styles remain visible on all FAQ triggers.

Review and finalize all on-page copy for premium, coherent English microcopy (remove any placeholders) and ensure fast initial render by keeping content primarily static with lightweight interactivity.

requirements.summary: Create and apply a coherent warm, premium artisan visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, component styling) consistently across the page.
acceptanceCriteria: Theme includes a defined primary/secondary color set, background treatment, and typography pairing used across hero, cards, buttons, and FAQ.
Buttons, cards, and badges share a consistent design system (radii, shadows, borders).
Theme avoids a default ‘generic SaaS’ look and does not rely on a blue/purple primary palette.

file_operations.description: Define warm artisan CSS variables (earthy primary/secondary, muted backgrounds) and add a subtle background treatment using frontend/public/assets/generated/artisan-texture-pattern.dim_1024x1024.png (e.g., as a low-contrast page texture) while maintaining readability.
Apply consistent spacing, background layering, and typography choices across sections to enforce the warm premium artisan design system.

Ensure Button variants (primary/secondary/ghost) align with the warm artisan theme (radii/shadows/borders) and are used consistently across the landing page. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Ensure Card styling (borders/shadows/radii) matches the theme and is consistent across curated hampers, testimonials, and banners. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Ensure badge/chip styling matches the theme and works on textured backgrounds with accessible contrast. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add a lightweight footer with contact links, Shipping/Returns information without navigating away, and a handmade brand note.
acceptanceCriteria: Footer includes at least one contact method presented as text and/or clickable links (mailto: / tel:).
Shipping/Returns information is present and readable without navigating away (either inline section or dialog).

file_operations.description: Create a footer with brand reassurance copy, mailto/tel contact links, and a Shipping/Returns info presentation that does not require navigation away (inline expandable block or dialog).
Create a shadcn/ui-style Dialog component (accessible modal) for displaying Shipping/Returns details without leaving the page. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire FooterSection at the bottom of the single-page layout and ensure it matches the overall theme and spacing.
